title-group.article-title: Computation of Real Quadratic Fields with Class Number One

abstract.p: A rapid method for determining whether the real quadratic field $\mathscr{K} = \mathscr{Q}(\sqrt D)$ has class number one is described. The method makes use of the infrastructure idea of Shanks to determine the regulator of $\mathscr{K}$ and then uses the Generalized Riemann Hypothesis to rapidly estimate $L(1, \chi)$ to the accuracy needed for determining whether or not the class number of $\mathscr{K}$ is one. The results of running this algorithm on a computer for all prime values of $D$ up to $10^9$ are also presented, together with further results on runs on intervals of size $10^7$ starting at $10^i (i = 9, 10,\ldots, 16)$.
